_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Policy
The owner,management and employees operating our facilities are committed to the prevnetion of any accidential release of hazardous chemicals transported or stored on our location. In the event that an accidential release should occur, we are prepared to work with our local fire department, emergency response personel, and other appropriate authorities deemed applicable depending on the specific incident to best mitigate any release and to minimize the impact of the release to people and the enviroment. 

Facility Information
The primary activity of our facility is the production of liquid micronutrients for crop production.The raw materials used in production includes the receiving,storage,and use of ammonia concentrate of 20 percent or greater CAS # 7664417 which is included in the EPA  Risk Management Program. This raw material is the subject of this plan and our only raw material on the list used by this facility. The on site amount of ammonia is much lower during our off season of July thru October. Our facility has adequate lighting and is inspected during use and off season.

Accidential Release Program
Our accidential release program is based on guidelines found in the American National Standard Institute (ANSI) and OSHA Standards for handling of ammonia. Additionly we conduct annual employee training on the safe handling,storage and use of ammonia.We installed preasure release valves,diking,and a scrubber on the liquid mixer to help avoid any accidental release of fumes. We also maintain contact with our local fire department and LEPC to update any changes in our operation.

Five Year Accident History
We have not had a release of ammonia within the past five years that has caused death,injury or significant property damage at this facility. To our knowledge we have not caused any off site deaths, injury, evacuation,sheltering in place,property damage or envirmental damage.

 Emergency Response Program 
 This facility is included in the writt

en Community Emergency Response Plan as prepared by the LEPC and the Kansas Emergency Emergency Management Agency (KEMA). We also include these materials in our own emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38. We provided state and local authorities all right to know information requested as well as that required under Sara Title III. Our written employee safety programs include pre-emergency planning and employee training in accordance with OSHA Standards, and are offered for review any time by our LEPC to ensure that they conform to the community plan. 

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Safety improvement is an on going process at our facility. Periodic evaluation are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions, There are no additional specific reccommendations for implementations at this time.
